sections.purpose: To provide a small flame for sterilization and heating in aseptic work.
sections.scope: Applicable as an alternative to Bunsen burner in Microbiology.
procedure: Fill the lamp with suitable spirit (e.g., ethanol) to the recommended level.
Insert and adjust the wick so that only a small portion is exposed.
Place the lamp on a stable, non-flammable surface.
Light the wick using a match or igniter.
Use the flame for sterilizing inoculating loops or needles as needed.
Extinguish the flame by placing the cap securely over the wick.
Allow the lamp to cool before refilling or moving it.
precautions: Keep fuel containers away from the open flame.
Never leave a lit lamp unattended.
Check for cracks or leaks in the lamp body before use.
